items.summary: As a part of a multi-part series, TechCrunch is highlighting women innovators — from academics to policymakers —in the field of AI.

items.title: Pinterest begins testing a ‘body type ranges’ tool to make searches more inclusive
items.summary: Pinterest is today expanding on its efforts to make its product more inclusive with respect to body type diversity with the test of a new consumer-facing tool that allows users to filter select searches by different body types. The feature, which will work with women’s fashion and wedding ideas at l

items.title: 20SALES closes $5M inaugural fund to invest in early-stage B2B SaaS startups
items.summary: Although the focus of the fund is not just to solely back women, it hopes to focus its efforts there when possible.

items.title: Women-founded AI startups see a boost in VC funding

items.title: AI is the next frontier — but for whom?
items.summary: Ethics is often a separate conversation from AI building, but they should be one and the same. Bias is dangerous, especially as AI continues spreading.

items.title: Debunking the myths of why venture investors don’t fund diverse startups

items.title: Women-founded startups raised 1.9% of all VC funds in 2022, a drop from 2021
items.summary: Last year, U.S. startups with all-women teams received 1.9% (or around $4.5 billion) out of around the $238.3 billion in venture capital allocated, according to the latest PitchBook data.

items.title: The lack of VC funding to women is a Western societal shortfall
items.summary: The issue of women founders not receiving equitable venture funding is a shortfall of the West: It’s here, everywhere in the U.S., and over there, all throughout Europe.

items.title: The highs and lows of Q3 venture capital data for women startup founders
items.summary: New PitchBook data found that U.S. companies with all female founders are raising less capital this year than the last. But it's not all bad news.

items.title: A look at progress toward venture equity this Women’s Equality Day
items.summary: Progress in the amount of venture capital funding raised by companies by all-women teams has been slow and daunting, if steady.
